sentence.text: Loss-of-function mutations of G protein-coupled acetylcholine receptor signaling pathway, which encodes G-protein subunit α11 (Gα11), a signaling partner for the calcium-sensing receptor (detection of calcium ion), result in familial hypocalciuric hypercalcemia type 2 (G protein-coupled acetylcholine receptor signaling pathway).

entity.text: G protein-coupled acetylcholine receptor signaling pathway
G protein-coupled acetylcholine receptor signaling pathway

sentence.text: G protein-coupled acetylcholine receptor signaling pathway is characterized by hypercalcemia, inappropriately normal or raised parathyroid hormone (negative regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II) concentrations, and normal or low urinary calcium excretion.

entity.text: G protein-coupled acetylcholine receptor signaling pathway
negative regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II
